RESOURCE.STRING: Heated Oxygen Sensor Test

The Heated Oxygen Sensor Test is used to help isolate and troubleshoot heated oxygen sensor problems by measuring the oxygen percentage using the heated oxygen sensor to see if it is in tolerance after the engine has been cranked, but not running.

Perform the following actions:
1. Set the parking brake.
2. Place the transmission in neutral.
3. Verify engine is stopped.
4. Select Start to start the test. After selecting Start, you will be asked to crank the engine for 8 seconds. The engine will not start. This test will take approximately 2 minutes to complete.
Select Start to start the test. After selecting Start, you will be asked to crank the engine for 8 seconds. The engine will not start. This test will take approximately 2 minutes to complete.
The test has been aborted for an unknown reason.
An unknown error has occurred.
Test stopped by operator.
The engine RPM must be equal to zero to start the test.
Heated oxygen sensor circuit fault detected. Troubleshoot the heated oxygen sensor circuit fault code before proceeding with this test.
The test could not be started for unknown reasons.
Select Start to start the test. After selecting Start, you will be asked to crank the engine for 8 seconds. The engine will not start. This test will take approximately 2 minutes to complete.
Test aborted , due to a fault detected in the heated oxygen sensor circuit.
Starting test. Please Wait.
Crank the engine for approximately 8 seconds.
The engine did not crank for at least 8 seconds. Restart the test.
The test has timed out. Restart the test.
Test Passed.
Test Failed. The oxygen sensor did not measure the percent of oxygen correctly. Refer to the Troubleshooting and Repair Manual for further instructions.
Select Start to start the test.
Cummins INSITE
